page.title: 08Making Bricks at Heather
page.content: On Wednesday May 15th, I came to school with my dad. He was going to take me and five other children to the brickyard because we were going to find out about brick making. When we arrived we went into the office. Frank, who was Deputy Manager, took us around. After we had been round we asked some questions. Altogether 550,000 bricks are made in a week. The materials used to make bricks are Kupar mild clay and water. The company has been going since early 1900. They employ 555 people. The bricks are sent to the following places: Scotland, Wales, Ireland, Saudi Arabia, Germany, France, Italy and Holland. The greatest number of bricks they have sold at once is 1 million 2 hundred thousand. They have spent half a million pounds building the new factory.
